block.para: Shows you how to use the &Python3long; to create a web application that lets you upload photos to an &S3long; (&S3;) bucket, use &REKlong; to analyze and label the photos, and use &SESlong; (&SES;) to send email reports of image analysis.
This example contains two main components: a web page written in JavaScript that is built with React, and a REST service written in Python that is built with Flask-RESTful.
You can use the React web page to:

listitem.para: Display a list of images that are stored in your &S3; bucket.
Upload images from your computer to your &S3; bucket.
Display images and labels that identify items that were detected in the image.
Get a report of all images in your &S3; bucket and send an email of the report.

block.para: The web page calls the REST service. The service sends requests to &AWS; to perform the following actions:

listitem.para: Get and filter the list of images in your &S3; bucket.
Use &REK; to analyze individual photos and get a list of labels that identify items that are detected in the photo.
Analyze all photos in your &S3; bucket and use &SES; to email a report.

block.para: For complete source code and instructions on how to set up and run, see the full example on GitHub.
